archivesspace-development.title: We need a validation tool to check for things the ASpace importer will reject or ignore

comments.body:
It appears that most of the schematron rules referenced here are now out of date. The rule regarding invalid characters is worth following up. Also, nothing more concrete here regarding the maximum field length allowed, so it's still trial and error. 

One takeaway from this file: ASpace silently drops `note` elements; should be converted to `odd`.

Create an oartrain user account for Symplectic Elements in the QA environment

comments.body:
This user account was created with the following:

```
ID: oartrain_sharedaccount
Email: sco@princeton.edu
Username: oartrain
First name: oartrain
Last name: Student Account
```

However, attempting to enable `CAS` for authentication results in the following error message:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/89444358-96ab7b00-d71f-11ea-9cbb-a916c05b991b.png)
I have just confirmed that `CAS` authentication *does* function as expected for my personal account for oaworkflow-dev.princeton.edu

The error message logged is the following:

```
Message: Violation of UNIQUE KEY constraint 'un_USER_tblUser_UsernameUnique'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'dbo.USER_tblUser'. The duplicate key value is (CAS‚Ñ¢oartrain).
```

Perhaps a database synchronization created a record to the `oartrain` user with CAS enabled but the user account itself was deleted at some point in the past?

I'm going to proceed by attempting to delete and recreate the account.
This did not resolve the error, I'm going to leave the user account with a temporary password for testing until I can determine a means by which to directly update the database.

dspace-development.title: Create a new user account for the DataSpace user Nan Xue nxue@princeton.edu
OAR Item downloads fail with an "invalid identifier" page

comments.body: This is not related to the Bitstreams for the underlying Item, as these are intact and I can retrieve the data using `dspace-jruby`. I instead suspect that this may be related to the URL generation in the theming layer.
Attempting to resolve this is going to be blocked until I can attempt to rebuild the JSPUI theme for the OAR.
As this is going to require that the theme be built on the server, I'm going to rebuild and redeploy this within a maintenance period from 05:15PM - 07:00PM this evening.

Attempting to build the DSpace installation on the OAR server is blocked given that there are network connectivity issues:

```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project dspace-solr: Could not resolve dependencies for project org.dspace:dspace-solr:war:5.5-SNAPSHOT: Failed to collect dependencies at org.restlet.jee:org.restlet:jar:2.1.1: Failed to read artifact descriptor for org.restlet.jee:org.restlet:jar:2.1.1: Could not transfer artifact org.restlet.jee:org.restlet:pom:2.1.1 from/to restlet (http://maven.restlet.org): Transfer failed for http://maven.restlet.org/org/restlet/jee/org.restlet/2.1.1/org.restlet-2.1.1.pom: Connection reset -> [Help 1]
[ERROR]
[ERROR] To see the full stack trace of the errors, re-run Maven with the -e switch.
[ERROR] Re-run Maven using the -X switch to enable full debug logging.
[ERROR]
[ERROR] For more information about the errors and possible solutions, please read the following articles:
[ERROR] [Help 1] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/DependencyResolutionException
[dspace@cisdr204l dspace]$ curl -I http://maven.restlet.org/org/restlet/jee/org.restlet/2.1.1/org.restlet-2.1.1.pom
curl: (56) Recv failure: Connection reset by peer
[dspace@cisdr204l dspace]$ curl http://google.com
<HTML><HEAD><meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html;charset=utf-8">
<TITLE>301 Moved</TITLE></HEAD><BODY>
```

Please note that this is not the case from within my local environment:
```
% curl -I http://maven.restlet.org/org/restlet/jee/org.restlet/2.1.1/org.restlet-2.1.1.pom
HTTP/1.1 301 Moved Permanently
Content-Length: 0
Connection: keep-alive
```

figgy.title: Coin ARKs should resolve to the catalog
PULFA Export Task should not run in Staging.
Only run export:pulfa on production db
Should pdf derivative file sets be deleted when a pdf file set is deleted?

comments.body:
Reviewing:

in spec/resources/cdl/automatic_ingester_spec.rb:12, shouldn't the code be doing this? It doesn't seem like it should be part of test setup. Line 18 is testing that this happened.

One general question. A file goes into the `cdl_in_path` and is moved to `cdl_in_path/ingesting` and then ingested via move from there. If the file is corrupted during these moves it seems like we lose the file entirely and it has to be re-scanned to be reingested -- is that correct? Is there some other guard against this?

Line 12 is an extra file to make sure it doesn't reingest files that are currently ingesting by a job which is either running or in the retry queue. I'll add a comment. 

We've never really had a problem with file system copies that I can think of. I can adjust it so that it doesn't remove the file until after the ingest is done if that makes you more comfortable?

In that case on line 12, can you use a different filename.

We have definitely had problems that show up during derivative generation and aren't really caught until much later. I'm not sure but I think sometimes the studio has found those files and they looked fine so they just ingested them again. That's the scenario I'm thinking of.
I just realized I forgot to get this to add it to a collection anyways. After I do that maybe we can chat about this on zoom?

Do you think this should get a release note?

Regardless, :thumbsup: approved
I think the release note should be for when the whole feature's done, personally.

orangelight.title: Change "Digital Content" link text to "View Digital Content"
Wireframe CDL item statuses in the catalog

comments.body:
Here's one initial sketch. Thoughts / suggestions? I think doing it this way could be good because we don't have to mix the CDL link into the "in the library" info -- this way no matter how many copies are on CDL there's only one link to the checkout. @escowles 

![OL-digital-lending-UI.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5cba1f45fec3b63424e0f761/21741b81-c0b3-46ea-a0e9-10b7e493a05f)

@hackmastera That looks good ‚Äî and I agree that having the CDL access highlighted in the Online section makes more sense than under the Copies in the Library section. I'm not sure about using the word "Sequestered" though ‚Äî maybe "Reserved for Digital Lending" or "Available via Digital Lending"?

One other piece of feedback from the DATF meeting this morning: it would be good to have the language for CDL and public/non-CDL items be the same, to help users consistently identify how they can access digital content. Right now, public items have a "Digital content" link. So please make the link text "View digital content" for both CDL and non-CDL items, with "Princeton users:" added for CDL items like you have here.
@escowles :thumbsup: thanks for this feedback

Here are updated wireframes under scenarios 1 and 3. I think scenarios 2 and 4 could easily be extrapolated from these but if not I'm happy to create more or simply clarify.

![Web 1920 ‚Äì 1.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5cba1f45fec3b63424e0f761/72793993-677c-4f53-8e48-aa389e1f0b3d)

![Web 1920 ‚Äì 2.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5cba1f45fec3b63424e0f761/d1e1bc79-052e-4a3e-a24f-ad70ab2517b8)
@hackmastera üëç  Yes, those look great!
Thanks! Also reviewed by @tpendragon and @christinach.
Just realized the capitalization should probably be "View digital content" not "View Digital content" -- will update those images.

pudl-migration.title: pudl0066 Civil War, Society and Political Transition in Guatemala

comments.body: This project began as METS/MODS, with the items generated by hand from a pre-EAD finding aid to the microfilm.  The METS/MODS, plus a version of pudl0066.ead and a final report (anonymous and undated) can be found in the Subversion repository:http://diglibsvn.princeton.edu/svn/puldi/pudl/branches/development/mdata/pudl0066

pulfalight.title: Implement the design for the Component View defined by the Summer 2020 wireframes

comments.body:
Introducing the changes on https://github.com/pulibrary/pulfalight/compare/issues-327-jrgriffiniii-component-view yielded the following design updates:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/89355646-e63f6780-d689-11ea-9570-930265d27606.png)

Unfortunately, there are still some indexing issues which seem to keep fields from being populated with the appropriate data from the fixtures. Additionally, the LUX does not maintain some of the icons needed to fully implement the design.
